intro: Hybanthus proctorii, commonly known as the Proctor's hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Brazil. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant is herbaceous, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
